Grouped_Utterances: I’d like to explore more about how to manage feelings of guilt when I can’t help everyone in my community.

Hey Ellie! I’ve been doing well. I’ve been focusing on staying present and practicing mindfulness. That’s wonderful to hear! Have you noticed any changes in your anxiety levels since implementing those practices? Yeah, I think it’s helped a lot. I’m not as overwhelmed by future worries.  Yes! I used it during a recent presentation at the community center. I was nervous, but I focused on my breath and it helped. It’s been interesting. I’ve been trying to communicate more openly with my parents, especially my dad.
It reinforced my belief that my art can connect people. It’s not just about me; it’s about the community. They feel stronger. I’m more open to connecting with others, and I appreciate their support.
I feel lighter, like the weight of my thoughts is lifted. It’s like I’m recharging my mind. It feels freeing. I’m not holding onto resentment as much, and it’s nice to let that go.
It went really well! People were engaged, and it felt good to share my art with them. They’ve been a bit awkward, but I think we’re starting to understand each other better.

I’ve been doing body scans and focusing on my breath. It’s grounding, especially when I feel anxious. I’m trying to listen more and not just react. I want to understand where they’re coming from. I think I need to keep practicing active listening and expressing my feelings honestly.
